name: df-symg
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(csymg, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s2, cab(s1, wf1o(cv(s1), cv(s0), cv(s0))), ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cv(s2)), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), cmpo(s3, s4, cv(s2), cv(s2), ccom(cv(s3), cv(s4)))), cop(cfv(cts, cnx), cfv(cpt, cxp(cv(s0), csn(cpw(cv(s0))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ SymGrp =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[{ s1 |(s1 : s0 ‚Üî s0)} / s2]{ <(Base ` ndx), s2 >, <(+ ` ndx),(s3 ‚àà s2, s4 ‚àà s2 ‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àò s4))>, <(TopSet ` ndx),(Xt_ `(s0 √ó { P(s0)}))> })
comment: Define the symmetric group on set ` x ` . We represent the group as the set of one-to-one onto functions from ` x ` to itself under function composition, and topologize it as a function space assuming the set is discrete. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 25-Feb-2008.)
